message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000. It's a valuable asset that's worth every penny. I believe this price is fair, considering the value it brings to your business.  Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your offer, but I think it's a bit too high. I'm willing to pay $900,000 for the product. I believe this price is more reasonable, considering the value it brings to my business.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $900,000 is too far below what I need to make this deal work.  How about we split the difference? I'm willing to come down to $1,050,000. It's a fair compromise that allows us both to walk away feeling good about the deal.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $950,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering the value it brings to my business.

Bob, I'm getting the feeling we're not going to be able to agree on a price. I'm willing to come down to $1,000,000, my absolute bottom line.  This is the final offer I'm prepared to make. If you're not interested, I'll have to move on to another buyer.
